Class IPPool

java.lang.Object
DeviceComponents.IPPool
public class IPPool extends Object
Represents a pool of IP addresses that can be assigned to devices. Manages available IPs within a subnet, along with related metadata like gateway and DNS server.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Izzy Kavanagh

  • Constructor Details

    • IPPool

      public IPPool(String poolName, int poolNumber, String gatewayIP)
      Constructs an IPPool instance with the given parameters
      Parameters:
      poolName - - the name of the IP pool
      poolNumber - - the pool's identifier number
      gatewayIP - - the default gateway IP for the pool

  • Method Details

    • getPoolName

      public String getPoolName()
      Gets the name of the IP pool.
      Returns:
      the pool name

    • setPoolName

      public void setPoolName(String poolName)
      Sets the name of the IP pool.
      Parameters:
      poolName - the name to assign to the IP pool

    • getGatewayIP

      public String getGatewayIP()
      Gets the configured gateway IP for the pool.
      Returns:
      the gateway IP address

    • setGatewayIP

      public void setGatewayIP(String gatewayIP)
      Sets the gateway IP address for the pool.
      Parameters:
      gatewayIP - the IP address to use as gateway

    • getDnsServerIP

      public String getDnsServerIP()
      Gets the configured DNS server IP.
      Returns:
      the DNS server IP address

    • setDnsServerIP

      public void setDnsServerIP(String dnsServerIP)
      Sets the DNS server IP address.
      Parameters:
      dnsServerIP - the IP address of the DNS server

    • getPoolNumber

      public int getPoolNumber()
      Gets the unique identifier number for the pool.
      Returns:
      the pool number

    • setPoolNumber

      public void setPoolNumber(int poolNumber)
      Sets the identifier number for the pool.
      Parameters:
      poolNumber - - the number to assign to the pool

    • setIpPoolRange

      public void setIpPoolRange(int start, int end, int subNetwork)
      Sets the range of IP addresses available in the pool. Also defines the subnet via the subNetwork parameter.
      Parameters:
      start - - the starting IP suffix (e.g., 10 for 192.168.x.10)
      end - - the ending IP suffix (e.g., 50 for 192.168.x.50)
      subNetwork - - the subnet number (e.g., 1 for 192.168.1.x)

    • getAvailableIPs

      public Set<String> getAvailableIPs()
      Retrieves the set of currently available IP addresses.
      Returns:
      a set of IP addresses available for assignment

    • checkIP

      public ErrorMessages checkIP(int startIP, int endIP, int subNetwork)
      Validates the input IP range and subnet values and returns appropriate errors
      Parameters:
      startIP - - the starting IP suffix
      endIP - - the ending IP suffix
      subNetwork - - the subnet number
      Returns:
      an ErrorMessages enum describing any issues, or null if valid
